This is a randomised trial comparing ephedrine and phenylephrine as used for accidental hypotension occurring during carotid surgery, on cerebral perfusion, assessed by near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRS).

brief_summary.textblock:
The effects on brain perfusion of the two currently vasopressors used to treat accidental
      hypotension occurring during carotid surgery (i.e. ephedrine and phenylephrine) is not
      known, but a disadvantage to use phenylephrine is suspected, due to its mechanism of action
      and according to published reports

clinical_study.brief_title: Compared Efficacy and Tolerance of Two Vasopressors Used to Treat Preoperative Hypotension During Carotid Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a randomised trial comparing ephedrine and phenylephrine as used for accidental
      hypotension occurring during carotid surgery, on cerebral perfusion, assessed by
      near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRS).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age over 18 ASA score I-III Planned carotid endarteriectomy under general anaesthesia
             Hypotension defined as SAP < 90 mm Hg during general anaesthesia Informed consent to
             the trial Protected by the French health welfare

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Emergency surgery Cardiac arrythmia Pregnancy or breastfeeding Allergy to the tested
             treatment Allergy to hydroxyethylstarch Allergy to the glue of the NIRS's electrodes
             Current medication: MAOI, intranasal vasopressors

clinical_study.official_title: Compared Efficacy and Tolerance of Two Vasopressors Used to Treat Preoperative Hypotension During Carotid Surgery. Prospective Randomised Controlled and Single Centre Trial
